"Change starts when someone sees the next step. " 
-William Drayton

Let's be a part of a change through Sociobizz'12, a Social B-plan competition aimed at creating sustainable and commercially viable business plans to the most challenging social problems.

1. Last date for submission of abstract is 7th October 2012.
2. The business plans may focus on any subject area.
3. The competition is open to students currently enrolled in any disciple or level of study,
at any academic institution worldwide.
4. Multidisciplinary teams are strongly encouraged.
5. Participant should be registered for Tathva'12 and thereby, produce a valid Tathva'12
ID at the time of registration/event.
6. The participant should abide by all the decisions taken by the judging panel and the
Tycoon Tathva'12 Organising Committee.
7. The participant should maintain discipline at all times and follow proper code of
conduct failing which his/her registration might be cancelled at any instant of time.

The event shall be conducted in two rounds:
Round 1: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ROUND
1. In this round participants will be submitting the executive summary of their social
B­plan to the following email: sociobizz12@tathva.org
○ The summary must be submitted in PDF (Standard Online Publishing and
Printing) format
○ The summary must be typed in 12pt Times New Roman font,1.5pt line space
and 1­inch margins on all sides inclusive of text, charts, and diagrams.
○ The summary should not exceed 3 pages excluding the cover page.
○ The cover page of the abstract should contain the following details:
○ NAME OF TEAM MEMBERS:
○ EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTE:
○ CONTACT DETAILS: (E­mail and contact number of any 2 members).
○ The filename should be titled using the following
format:TeamName_Sociobizz_ExecSummary.pdf
2. The abstract should clearly outline your Social Business idea. Financials may be
provided if necessary.
3. Based upon the abstract teams will be short­listed for the for the final round.
4. The short listed teams will receive intensive mentoring from our distinguished panel
of members.
NOTE: The business plan to be presented should follow the format provided in the
document which can be downloaded from:
http://www.4shared.com/office/kIv0YWJV/Final_Business_Plan_Submission.htmlRound 2:
FINAL PRESENTATION
1. The short listed teams will present their B­plans infront of the judges in the form of a
presentation during the event.
2. A maximum of 15 minutes will be given to each team to present their idea. Marks
shall be deducted for exceeding the time limit.
3. The presentation will be followed by a question and answer section for 10 minutes
from judges and the audience.
4. The selected teams must submit two hard copies of their B­plan 1 hour prior to their
final presentation to the SocioBizz event Organisers.
5. Business Plan must not be more than 25 pages typed in 12pt Times New Roman
font, 1.5pt line spacing, 1 inch borders inclusive of text, charts, and diagrams. A
cover page, if included, will not be counted.
6. Business plans must include a Social Impact Assessment section.
